data.title: UCLA University Archives. Biographical files (Reference Collection).
data.text:
Aaron, Benjamin. b.1915 September 2 - d.2007 August 25

General note

UCLA faculty, Law.

Ashe, Arthur (UCLA 1965). b.1943 July 10 - d.1993 February 3

Scope and Contents note

Includes program for 1969 September 20-28 Pacific Southwest Open Tennis Championships (Los Angeles Tennis Club).

General note

Arthur Ashe became a professional tennis player.

Bloom, Leonard. SEE: Broom, Leonard [NOTE: changed name from Bloom to Broom c.1949]

Breslow, Lester. b.1915 March 17 - d.2012 April 9

General note

UCLA faculty, Health Services (School of Public Health); Dean, School of Public Health (1972-1980).

Burns, E. Bradford. b.1932 August 28 - d.1995 December 19

General note

UCLA faculty, History.

Burns, Robert I., S.J. b.1921 August 16 - d.2008 November 22

General note

UCLA faculty, History.

Crabtree, Charlotte A. (UCLA 1948). b.1927 August 14 - d.2006 April 15

General note

UCLA faculty, Education (1961-1993); founding director of the National Center for History in the Schools (NCHS).

Dean, James Byron. b.1931 February 8 - d.1955 September 30

General note

Actor; attended UCLA Fall 1950.

El-Sayed, Mostafa A. b.1933 May 8

General note

UCLA Faculty - Physical Chemistry.

Hirsch, Werner Z. b.1920 June 10 - d.2009 July 10

General note

UCLA faculty, Economics (1963-1990) and founding director of UCLA Institute of Government and Public Affairs.

Kaesz, Herbert David. b.1933 January 4 - d.2012

Container Summary: UCLA Chemistry Department (1960- )

McBride, George McCutchen. b.1876 October 11 - d.1971 October 7

General note

UCLA Professor of Geography, 1922-1948.

McCarthy, James Howard. b.1911 June 4 - d.1975 February 11

Newcomer, Victor D. b.1916 April 5 - d.2002 March 15

General note

Professor of Medicine/Dermatology, 1961-1973.

Oppenheimer, Valerie Kincade. b.1932 October 25 - d.2009 November 2

General note

UCLA Faculty Sociology, 1968-1994.

Panunzio, Constantine M. b.1884 October 5 - d.1964 August 6

General note

UCLA Professor, Sociology; first faculty to teach sociology (also known as social science) at UCLA (1931).

Pomraning, Gerald C. b.1936 February 23 - d.1999 February 6

General note

UCLA Faculty, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering.

Powell, Lawrence Clark. b.1906 September 3 - d.2001 March 14

General note

UCLA Librarian (1944-1961); Director, William Andrews Clark Memorial Library (1944-1966) founder and Dean, UCLA School of Library Service (1959-1966).

Putnam, A. Evelyn. b.1908 February 8 - d.1998

General note

Wife of William C. Putnam, UCLA Faculty-Geology.

Sawhill, Clarence E. b.1906 November 5

General note

Clarence Sawhill, UCLA Band Director (1952-1972).

Schauwecker, Frederick. b.1896 August 31 - d.1975 February 1

General note

Frederick Schauwecker, piano accompianist, taught at UCLA Extension.

Shneidman, Edwin S. (UCLA 1938, M.A. 1940) b.1918 May 13 - d.2009 May

General note

UCLA Prof. of Medical Psychology (1970-1975, Neuropsychiatric Institute); UCLA Professor of Thanatology (1975-1988, Neuropsychiatric Institute). Founder of the Los Angeles Suicide Prevention Center (1958) and the American Association of Suicidology (1968).

Smith, Homer Austin. b.1931 October 9 - d.2011 April 10

General note

UCLA assistant football coach: offensive backfield coach (1973- ); offensive coordinator (1980- ).

Spaulding, William Henry. 1880 May 4 - 1966 October

General note

William H. (Bill) Spaulding served as UCLA football coach from 1925-1938; in 1938 Spaulding retired from coaching to become the UCLA athletic director.

Starkie, Walter Fitzwilliam. b.1894 August 9 - d.1976 November 2

General note

UCLA Professor, Spanish; Center for the Study of Comparative Folklore and Mythology.

Stoutmeyer, Vernon T. b.1905 January 9

General note

UCLA Professor of Botany (College of Agriculture); Professor of Agricultural Sciences; Associate Director of the California Agriculture Experiment Station. Stoutmeyer retired from UCLA in 1972.

Stoutmeyer, Vernon T. b.1905 january 9

Sumner, Anne (UCLA 1926). b.1904 July - d.2008 February 9

Werner, Newton Davis. b.1934 June 18 - d.2000 October 3

West, Louis Jolyon, M.D. b.1924 October 6 - d.1999 January 2

Biography/History

Louis Jolyon "Jolly" West, chair of the UCLA Department of Behavioral Sciences and director of the UCLA Neuropsychiatric Institute (NPI), 1969-1988.

Scope and Content

Includes: Neuropsychiatric Grand Rounds Tribute to Louis Jolyon West, 1999 March 2 (video tape recording - two VHS cassettes).

Powell, Lawrence Clark. b.1906 September 3 - d.2001 March 14

General note

UCLA Librarian (1944-1961); Director, William Andrews Clark Memorial Library (1944-1966) founder and Dean, UCLA School of Library Service (1959-1966).

Shneidman, Edwin S. (UCLA 1938, M.A. 1940) b.1918 May 13 - d.2009 May

General note

UCLA Prof. of Medical Psychology (1970-1975, Neuropsychiatric Institute); UCLA Professor of Thanatology (1975-1988, Neuropsychiatric Institute). Founder of the Los Angeles Suicide Prevention Center (1958) and the American Association of Suicidology (1968).
